schedule.description: Arrival, Registration, Refreshments
Seat/ Table allocation.
Kick-off Session - Welcome note by Amit Thawani and Sirisha Voruganti.
Kick-off Session - Expectation setting by Amit Thawani, Laura Armstrong and Aritra Chakravarty.
Kick-off Session - Physical and digital security policy and fire safety guidelines overview by Harpal Garewal. Physical and digital security policy and fire safety guidelines overview
Kick-off Session - Hackathon Overview & Resources by Chinni Vasudeva.
Set up IT - Presentation and set up time by Cloud SMEs from sandbox and LTC. Wi-fi set up, Sandbox access and queries
Break & Networking
Hack - Ideation Phase. Hack to proceed, coaches to support and walk around
Lunch & Networking
Hack - Build and Test 1. Hack to proceed, coaches to support and walk around
Hack - Build and Test 2. Hack to proceed, coaches to support and walk around
Break & Networking
Hack - Build and Test 3. Hack to proceed, coaches to support and walk around
Day ends (but hack continues*). *Internal participants can choose to stay back and continue the hack.
Day 2: Arrival, Refreshments
Day 2: Hack - Build and Test 4. Hack to proceed, coaches to support and walk around
Day 2: Break & Networking
Day 2: Hack - Build and Test 5. Hack to proceed, coaches to support and walk around
Day 2: Preparation for pitch to the judges.
Day 2: Lunch & Networking
Day 2: Pitch - Pitches to Judges by Participants. Each team has 3 minutes to pitch their idea and 2 mins for Q&A.
Day 2: Break & Networking. Break for participants whilst the judges deliberate
Day 2: Wrap Up - Judges Deliberate.
Day 2: Wrap Up - Winners Announced & Awards & Closing Speeches.
Day 2: Note of thanks by Mukul Saini
Day 2: Day ends

hackers.welcomeDescription: Here are some details about what you will be doing at the hackathon. We can't wait to see what you create!

importantInfo.title: Devices & Set-Up
items: Please bring your own personal devices to participate.
You will code in a sandbox environment enabled for these 2 days. Login details will be provided at the venue.

hackers.challengeDescription: Your team will be allocated a challenge based on a problem statement. The theme for the Hackathon is Agentic AI.

externalChallenges.title: Improving IP&I Data Quality
externalChallenges.businessProblem: IP&I aims to have 80% of data on GCP by 2025. Manual data quality checks are slow and inconsistent. Data inaccuracies cause reporting risks, which affect regulatory returns
externalChallenges.hackableScope: Build an agentic solution that detects, categorises, and remediates data quality issues autonomously; focus on large-scale anomaly detection and remediation

externalChallenges.title: Financial Goal Coaching via Voice-based Agentic Agent
externalChallenges.businessProblem: There is a gap in the market for a non-human voice channel to coach customers on how to achieve their financial goals. This offering would give IP&I a complimentary USP to sit alongside the InvestAI proposition
externalChallenges.hackableScope: Explore conversational design for an AI voice-based coach to support customers and help us maintain advice/guidance boundaries in an interactive experience

externalChallenges.title: Agentic AI Servicing Agent in Home Insurance
externalChallenges.businessProblem: Digital servicing journeys cover 85% of customer demands; remaining 15% require human agents. Building digital journeys for these is uneconomical meaning that human agents are required to support customers
externalChallenges.hackableScope: Create an AI voice servicing agent that can handle non-digital home insurance queries using available knowledge assets

externalChallenges.title: Automating Customer Communication Review for Compliance & Clarity
externalChallenges.businessProblem: IP&I Heritage produces over 3,500 types of customer letters. Reviewing these outputs against Consumer Duty standards and editorial tools (e.g., Acrolinx) is a highly manual, time-intensive process. Due to resource constraints, not all letters are reviewed, leading to unclear communications, increased contact centre calls, complaints, and rectification events
externalChallenges.hackableScope: Build an Agentic AI-powered solution that can autonomously create and review customer communication outputs from structured and unstructured product data, and against compliance, clarity standards, and other triggers, providing actionable insights and prioritisation for improvements

challenges.title: Data: Improving IP&I Data Quality
challenges.businessProblem: IP&I aims to have 80% of data on GCP by 2025. Manual data quality checks are slow and inconsistent. Need automated anomaly detection and remediation.
challenges.hackableScope: Build an agentic solution that detects, categorizes, and remediates data quality issues autonomously
challenges.postHackathonRoadmap: Can scale across IP&I's data estate and integrate with group data governance.

challenges.title: D2C Growth: Creating a digital wallet to unlock digital assets
challenges.businessProblem: Digital wallets are a requirement if IP&I wants to offer digital assets and IP&I is not technologically ready to offer digital wallet capabilities to customers
challenges.hackableScope: Build a digital wallet prototype, utilising AI within the design.
challenges.postHackathonRoadmap: A digital wallet unlocks future use cases (e.g. digital identity and tokenised assets)

challenges.title: D2C Growth: Financial Goal Coaching via Voice-Based Agentic Agent
challenges.businessProblem: There is a gap in the market for a non-intrusive voice channel to coach customers on how to achieve their financial goals. This offering would give IP&I a complimentary USP to sit alongside the InvestAI proposition
challenges.hackableScope: Create an AI voice-based coach to support customers to work through how to achieve their financial goals
challenges.postHackathonRoadmap: Solution could be expanded to other guidance touchpoints (e.g. decumulation, protection needs etc.)

challenges.title: Customer/Client Services: Agentic AI Servicing Agent in Home Insurance
challenges.businessProblem: Digital servicing journeys cover 85% of customer demands; remaining 15% require human agents. Building digital journeys for these is uneconomical meaning that human agents are required to support customers
challenges.hackableScope: Create an AI servicing agent that can handle digital Home Insurance queries using available knowledge assets.
challenges.postHackathonRoadmap: Solution can be extended into Insurance claims as well as other products within IP&I

challenges.title: Customer/Client Services: Automating Customer Communication Review for Compliance & Clarity
challenges.businessProblem: IP&I Heritage produces over 3,500 types of customer letters. Reviewing these outputs against Consumer Duty standards and editorial tools (e.g., Acrolinx) is highly manual. Intensive process. Due to resource constraints, not all letters are reviewed, leading to unclear communications, increased contact centre calls, complaints, and rectification events.
challenges.hackableScope: Build an Agentic AI-powered solution that can autonomously review structured and unstructured customer communication outputs against compliance and clarity standards, providing actionable insights and prioritisation for improvements.
challenges.postHackathonRoadmap: Solution can extend to other customer-facing materials (call scripts, marketing documents) and scale across IP&I.

challenges.title: Customer/Client Services: Streamlining Workplace Scheme Onboarding
challenges.businessProblem: The scheme Onboarding journey is heavily manual with multiple human touchpoints. This will act as a bottleneck as the Workplace business grows.
challenges.hackableScope: Develop an AI solution using various structured and unstructured feeds like: RAID logs, call summaries and tracking data to create a Project control tower to identify weekly risk and suggest actions for employers
challenges.postHackathonRoadmap: Similar solution can be adopted to challenge the number of human touchpoints in other internal processes and add cognitive elapsed time reduction recommendations to similar processes

challenges.title: Bancassurance: Leveraging Banking Data to understand our Customers' Propensity to Protect
challenges.businessProblem: Understanding what customers are most likely to require our protection products, meaning that we can nudge customers to relevant protection products at critical life moments (e.g. the birth of a child or moving home). By not leveraging banking data, we are missing out on a key source of insight into our customers and their needs.
challenges.hackableScope: Develop an AI solution that uses banking data to identify our customers' 'Propensity to Protect'
challenges.postHackathonRoadmap: Solution an extend to marketing personalisation and other Insurance products.

challenges.title: Bancassurance: Leveraging Banking Data to Streamline Protection Underwriting
challenges.businessProblem: Protection pricing does not leverage banking data, which could be used to reduce the need for manual underwriting (e.g. if purchasing habits indicated healthy habits). Manual underwriting is heavy, causing drop-offs and poor customer experience.
challenges.hackableScope: Develop an AI solution that uses banking data to reduce manual underwriting.

challenges.title: Actuarial: Replacing ResQ within the Insurance Actuarial Process to enable Proactive Risk and Reserving Confidence
challenges.businessProblem: IP&I Finance uses ResQ in its reserving process, which is manual and fragmented, leading to delays in insights and decisions. Adverse trends are detected late, impacting pricing actions and reserve confidence. Opportunity exists for ML/AI to detect drivers earlier and trigger timely actions.
challenges.hackableScope: Build an AI-driven resQ'ing solution that automates data ingestion, analysis, and reporting, replacing ResQ and reducing manual effort.
challenges.postHackathonRoadmap: Solution can scale to other reserving models and portfolios across IP&I.

hackers.judgingDescription: Our judges will be considering the following when casting their vote:

criteria.title: Value and Proposition (20%)
criteria.description:
Business Value: Does the solution address a real problem or opportunity? Is it likely to deliver measurable impact for users, customers, or the organisation?

Market Overview: Is there a clear understanding of the market landscape? Has the team identified competitors, gaps, and potential for adoption or growth?

criteria.title: Agentic Feasibility (20%)
criteria.description:
Agentic Architecture: Does the solution leverage agentic AI principles (autonomy, decision-making, multi-agent collaboration)? Is the approach technically sound and feasible within current or near-future capabilities?

Scalability & Integration: Can the solution be realistically implemented and scaled within your organisation's tech stack? Are integration points with existing systems considered?

criteria.title: Innovation & Originality (20%)
criteria.description:
Creativity: Is the idea novel or does it offer a fresh approach to an existing challenge? Does it stand out from other submissions?

Theme Alignment: How well does the solution embody the hackathon's theme of Agentic AI?

criteria.title: Technical Execution (20%)
criteria.description:
Functionality: Is there a working prototype or MVP? Does it demonstrate the core features and agentic capabilities?

Quality & Robustness: Is the solution stable, well-documented, and free from major bugs? Is the technical approach well-justified?

criteria.title: Usability & Accessibility (10%)
criteria.description:
User Experience: Is the solution intuitive and easy to use? Can users quickly understand and interact with the agentic AI features?

Accessibility: Are there options or considerations for users with different needs or backgrounds?

criteria.title: Presentation & Communication (10%)
criteria.description: Pitch Quality: Is the team able to clearly articulate their idea, its value, and how agentic AI is applied? Is the presentation engaging and convincing?

judgingCriteria.criteriaDescription: If you would like a more detailed breakdown of the judging criteria, you can download it below.

Pitches.title: Pitches
Pitches.description: On day two, all teams will pitch their solutions directly to the judging panel.
Pitches.length: Each team will have 3 minutes to pitch their idea plus 2 minutes for Q&A. All 31 teams will be judged, with 10 winners selected - at least one from each problem statement category.
Pitches.presentation: You can use slides, a live demo, or any other format you like to present your solution. Be creative and have fun!
Pitches.prepTime: Teams should prepare their pitches between 12:45pm - 1:15pm
Pitches.judgeTime: Pitches to the judges will begin at 1:45pm and continue until 4:45pm

Awards.description: The winning teams will be announced at the end of day two, with prizes as follows:

prizes.all:
You will be invited to LBG to bring your idea to life in the Scottish Widows App.

 Each team member will receive 1-2-1 mentorship from a Women ConnecTech mentor.

 Plus tickets to our Reboot conference in November.
Your team will receive career workshops and tickets to our Reboot conference in November.
Your team will receive career workshops

homepage.welcome: Welcome to the CIO IP&I Hackathon!
intro: Thank you for joining us for this fast-paced, creative sprint! Over the next 48 hours, you'll collaborate with around 160 participants to prototype bold new ideas.
Form teams of up to five and tackle a real-world business challenge. Brainstorm, design, build, and pitch a working MVP from scratch.
Volunteers and mentors are available throughout to guide you. Good luck, have fun, and let's innovate together!

eventDetails.title: Event Details
eventDetails.refreshments: Refreshments and snacks will be served throughout both days.

location.title: Getting here
location.address: Lloyds Banking Group, Wing A & B, 22nd, 23rd and 24th Floor, Tower 2, Sattva Knowledge Park, Hitec City, Hyderabad, Telangana - 500081
location.transport: Transport to the venue will be arranged by Lloyds Technology Centre through Company Cabs

wifi.title: WiFi
wifi.description: WiFi login will be available on the day

footer.supportText: Our organisers and support team will be available to help during the event.

photography.title: Photography
photography.description: Please note that personal photography is not permitted during the event. Official photos will be shared by the hackathon organizers.

organizers.title: Venue Access
organizers.description: For external participants, please remain on Floor 23 where all hackathon activities and facilities are located. Floors 22 and 24 are restricted areas.

externalParticipants.title: Please note
items: We kindly ask all participants to respect the rules and guidelines. Following these rules ensures a safe and smooth experience for everyone. Any breaches to these will result in you being asked to leave the event.  Thank you for your cooperation.

conduct.title: Code of Conduct
conduct.introduction: We aim to provide a friendly and supportive environment for all attendees. Let's ensure everyone gets the most from the day.
conduct.valuesTitle: Please follow the Lloyds Banking Group values

values.name: Inclusive
values.description: Recognise and celebrate the things that differentiate us, be inclusive in your actions and language. Help us make the event something for everyone to benefit from.

values.name: Sustainability
values.description: Travel sustainably and minimise waste at the event. Don't throw away reusable giveaway items - if you don't need/want it, don't accept it.

values.name: Trust
values.description: Assume peers are working in our best interests and trust them in their endeavours.

values.name: Bold
values.description: Be prepared to meet new people, learn new things and experiment with technology. Push yourself out of your comfort zone, do something new and enjoy the experience.

values.name: People First
values.description: Treat each other with respect and go the extra mile to support your peers. Be prepared to provide those around you with help, guidance and support.

conduct.closing: If you witness or experience inappropriate behaviour, please address it respectfully or speak to one of the event organisers.
